001package squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx;
002
003import com.badlogic.gdx.Gdx;
004import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color;
005import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch;
006import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion;
007import com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Actor;
008import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.IntMap;
009import squidpony.IColorCenter;
010import squidpony.StringKit;
011import squidpony.panel.ISquidPanel;
012
013import java.util.ArrayList;
014import java.util.Collection;
015
016/**
017 * Displays text and images in a grid pattern, like SquidPanel, but will automatically render certain chars as images.
018 * Supports basic animations, such as sliding, wiggling, or fading the contents of a cell.
019 * <br>
020 * Grid width and height settings are in terms of number of cells. Cell width and height are in terms of number of
021 * pixels (when there is no stretching taking place due to viewport or window size).
022 * <br>
023 * @author Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com
024 * @author Tommy Ettinger
025 */
026public class ImageSquidPanel extends SquidPanel {
027
028    public IntMap<TextureRegion> imageMap;
029
030    /**
031     * Creates a bare-bones panel with all default values for text rendering.
032     *
033     * @param gridWidth the number of cells horizontally
034     * @param gridHeight the number of cells vertically
035     */
036    public ImageSquidPanel(int gridWidth, int gridHeight) {
037        this(gridWidth, gridHeight, new TextCellFactory().defaultSquareFont());
038    }
039
040    /**
041     * Creates a panel with the given grid and cell size. Uses a default square font.
042     *
043     * @param gridWidth the number of cells horizontally
044     * @param gridHeight the number of cells vertically
045     * @param cellWidth the number of horizontal pixels in each cell
046     * @param cellHeight the number of vertical pixels in each cell
047     */
048    public ImageSquidPanel(int gridWidth, int gridHeight, int cellWidth, int cellHeight) {
049        this(gridWidth, gridHeight, new TextCellFactory().defaultSquareFont().width(cellWidth).height(cellHeight).initBySize());
050    }
051
052    /**
053     * Builds a panel with the given grid size and all other parameters determined by the factory. Even if sprite images
054     * are being used, a TextCellFactory is still needed to perform sizing and other utility functions.
055     *
056     * If the TextCellFactory has not yet been initialized, then it will be sized at 12x12 px per cell. If it is null
057     * then a default one will be created and initialized.
058     *
059     * @param gridWidth the number of cells horizontally
060     * @param gridHeight the number of cells vertically
061     * @param factory the factory to use for cell rendering
062     */
063    public ImageSquidPanel(int gridWidth, int gridHeight, TextCellFactory factory) {
064        this(gridWidth, gridHeight, factory, DefaultResources.getSCC());
065    }
066
067    /**
068     * Builds a panel with the given grid size and all other parameters determined by the factory. Even if sprite images
069     * are being used, a TextCellFactory is still needed to perform sizing and other utility functions.
070     *
071     * If the TextCellFactory has not yet been initialized, then it will be sized at 12x12 px per cell. If it is null
072     * then a default one will be created and initialized.
073     *
074     * @param gridWidth the number of cells horizontally
075     * @param gridHeight the number of cells vertically
076     * @param factory the factory to use for cell rendering
077     * @param center
078     *                  The color center to use. Can be {@code null}, but then must be set later on with
079     *          {@link #setColorCenter(IColorCenter)}.
080     */
081    public ImageSquidPanel(int gridWidth, int gridHeight, TextCellFactory factory, IColorCenter<Color> center) {
082        this(gridWidth, gridHeight, factory, center, 0f, 0f);
083    }
084
085    /**
086     * Builds a panel with the given grid size and all other parameters determined by the factory. Even if sprite images
087     * are being used, a TextCellFactory is still needed to perform sizing and other utility functions.
088     *
089     * If the TextCellFactory has not yet been initialized, then it will be sized at 12x12 px per cell. If it is null
090     * then a default one will be created and initialized.
091     *
092     * @param gridWidth the number of cells horizontally
093     * @param gridHeight the number of cells vertically
094     * @param factory the factory to use for cell rendering
095     * @param center
096     *                  The color center to use. Can be {@code null}, but then must be set later on with
097     *          {@link #setColorCenter(IColorCenter)}.
098     */
099    public ImageSquidPanel(int gridWidth, int gridHeight, TextCellFactory factory, IColorCenter<Color> center,
100                           float xOffset, float yOffset) {
101        this(gridWidth, gridHeight, factory, center, xOffset, yOffset, null);
102    }
103    /**
104     * Builds a panel with the given grid size and all other parameters determined by the factory. Even if sprite images
105     * are being used, a TextCellFactory is still needed to perform sizing and other utility functions. Importantly,
106     * this constructor takes a 2D char array argument that can be sized differently than the displayed area. The
107     * displayed area is gridWidth by gridHeight in cells, but the actualMap argument can be much larger, and only a
108     * portion will be displayed at a time. This requires some special work with the Camera and Viewports to get working
109     * correctly; in the squidlib module's examples, EverythingDemo may be a good place to see how this can be done.
110     * You can pass null for actualMap, which will simply create a char array to use internally that is exactly
111     * gridWidth by gridHeight, in cells.
112     * <br>
113     * If the TextCellFactory has not yet been initialized, then it will be sized at 12x12 px per cell. If it is null
114     * then a default one will be created and initialized. The xOffset and yOffset arguments are measured in pixels or
115     * whatever sub-cell unit of measure your game uses (world coordinates, in libGDX parlance), and change where the
116     * SquidPanel starts drawing by simply adding to the initial x and y coordinates. 0 and 0 are usually fine.
117     *
118     * @param gridWidth the number of cells horizontally
119     * @param gridHeight the number of cells vertically
120     * @param factory the factory to use for cell rendering
121     * @param center
122     *                  The color center to use. Can be {@code null}, but then must be set later on with
123     *          {@link #setColorCenter(IColorCenter)}.
124     * @param xOffset the x offset to start rendering at, in pixels (or some other sub-cell measurement your game uses)
125     * @param yOffset the y offset to start rendering at, in pixels (or some other sub-cell measurement your game uses)
126     * @param actualMap will often be a different size than gridWidth by gridHeight, which enables camera scrolling
127     */
128    public ImageSquidPanel(int gridWidth, int gridHeight, TextCellFactory factory, IColorCenter<Color> center,
129                           float xOffset, float yOffset, char[][] actualMap) {
130        super(gridWidth, gridHeight, factory, center, xOffset, yOffset, actualMap);
131        imageMap = new IntMap<>(128);
132    }
133    /**
134     * Draws this ImageSquidPanel and any {@link #autoActors} it has, and calls {@link Actor#act(float)} for each
135     * AnimatedEntity this contains in {@link #animatedEntities} or {@link #autoActors}.
136     * <br>
137     * This will set the shader of {@code batch} if using a distance field or MSDF font and the shader is currently not
138     * configured for such a font; it does not reset the shader to the default so that multiple Actors can all use the
139     * same shader and so specific extra glyphs or other items can be rendered after calling draw(). If you need to draw
140     * both a distance field font and full-color art, you should set the shader on the Batch to null when you want to
141     * draw full-color art, and end the Batch between drawing this object and the other art.
142     * @param batch a Batch such as a {@link FilterBatch} that must be between a begin() and end() call; usually done by Stage
143     * @param parentAlpha only used when drawing children of this ImageSquidPanel
144     */
145    @Override
146    public void draw (Batch batch, float parentAlpha) {
147        textFactory.configureShader(batch);
148        int inc = onlyRenderEven ? 2 : 1, widthInc = inc * cellWidth, heightInc = inc * cellHeight;
149        TextureRegion tr;
150        float screenX = xOffset - (gridOffsetX <= 0 ? 0 : cellWidth) + getX(),
151                screenY_base = 1f + yOffset + (gridOffsetY <= 0 ? 0 : cellHeight) + gridHeight * cellHeight + getY(), screenY;
152        char c;
153        for (int x = Math.max(0, gridOffsetX-1), xx = (gridOffsetX <= 0) ? 0 : -1; xx <= gridWidth && x < contents.length; x += inc, xx += inc, screenX += widthInc) {
154            screenY = screenY_base;
155            for (int y = Math.max(0, gridOffsetY-1), yy = (gridOffsetY <= 0) ? 0 : -1; yy <= gridHeight && y < contents[x].length; y += inc, yy += inc, screenY -= heightInc) {
156                c = contents[x][y];
157                tr = imageMap.get(c);
158                if(tr == null)
159                    textFactory.draw(batch, c, colors[x][y], screenX, screenY);
160                else
161                    textFactory.draw(batch, tr, colors[x][y], screenX, screenY);
162            }
163        }
164        super.draw(batch, parentAlpha);
165        int len = animatedEntities.size();
166        for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
167
168            animatedEntities.getAt(i).actor.act(Gdx.graphics.getDeltaTime());
169        }
170        len = autoActors.size();
171        Actor a;
172        for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
173            a = autoActors.getAt(i);
174            if(a == null) continue;
175            drawActor(batch, parentAlpha, a);
176            a.act(Gdx.graphics.getDeltaTime());
177        }
178    }
179
180    /**
181     * Draws one AnimatedEntity, specifically the Actor it contains. Batch must be between start() and end()
182     * @param batch Must have start() called already but not stop() yet during this frame.
183     * @param parentAlpha This can be assumed to be 1.0f if you don't know it
184     * @param ae The AnimatedEntity to draw; the position to draw ae is stored inside it.
185     */
186    public void drawActor(Batch batch, float parentAlpha, AnimatedEntity ae)
187    {
188        drawActor(batch, parentAlpha, ae.actor);
189    }
190
191    /**
192     * Draws one AnimatedEntity, specifically the Actor it contains. Batch must be between start() and end()
193     * @param batch Must have start() called already but not stop() yet during this frame.
194     * @param parentAlpha This can be assumed to be 1.0f if you don't know it
195     * @param ac The Actor to draw; the position to draw ac is modified and reset based on some fields of this object
196     */
197    public void drawActor(Batch batch, float parentAlpha, Actor ac)
198    {
199        float prevX = ac.getX(), prevY = ac.getY();
200        ac.setPosition(prevX - gridOffsetX * cellWidth, prevY + gridOffsetY * cellHeight);
201        ac.draw(batch, parentAlpha);
202        ac.setPosition(prevX, prevY);
203    }
204
205    @Override
206        public void setDefaultForeground(Color defaultForeground) {
207        this.defaultForeground = defaultForeground;
208    }
209
210        @Override
211        public Color getDefaultForegroundColor() {
212                return defaultForeground;
213        }
214
215    public AnimatedEntity getAnimatedEntityByCell(int x, int y) {
216        for(AnimatedEntity ae : animatedEntities)
217        {
218            if(ae.gridX == x && ae.gridY == y)
219                return ae;
220        }
221        return  null;
222    }
223
224    /**
225     * Create an AnimatedEntity at position x, y, using the char c in the given color.
226     * @param x
227     * @param y
228     * @param c
229     * @param color
230     * @return
231     */
232    public AnimatedEntity animateActor(int x, int y, char c, Color color)
233    {
234        return animateActor(x, y, false, c, color);
235    }
236
237    /**
238     * Create an AnimatedEntity at position x, y, using the char c in the given color. If doubleWidth is true, treats
239     * the char c as the left char to be placed in a grid of 2-char cells.
240     * @param x
241     * @param y
242     * @param doubleWidth
243     * @param c
244     * @param color
245     * @return
246     */
247    public AnimatedEntity animateActor(int x, int y, boolean doubleWidth, char c, Color color)
248    {
249        TextureRegion tr = imageMap.get(c);
250        if(tr != null)
251            return animateActor(x, y, doubleWidth, tr, color, String.valueOf(c));
252        Actor a = textFactory.makeActor(c, color);
253        a.setName(String.valueOf(c));
254        a.setPosition(adjustX(x, doubleWidth), adjustY(y));
255        AnimatedEntity ae = new AnimatedEntity(a, x, y, doubleWidth);
256        animatedEntities.add(ae);
257        return ae;
258    }
259
260    /**
261     * Create an AnimatedEntity at position x, y, using the String s in the given color.
262     * @param x
263     * @param y
264     * @param s
265     * @param color
266     * @return
267     */
268    public AnimatedEntity animateActor(int x, int y, String s, Color color)
269    {
270        return animateActor(x, y, false, s, color);
271    }
272
273    /**
274     * Create an AnimatedEntity at position x, y, using the String s in the given color. If doubleWidth is true, treats
275     * the String s as starting in the left cell of a pair to be placed in a grid of 2-char cells.
276     * @param x
277     * @param y
278     * @param doubleWidth
279     * @param s
280     * @param color
281     * @return
282     */
283    public AnimatedEntity animateActor(int x, int y, boolean doubleWidth, String s, Color color)
284    {
285        Actor a = textFactory.makeActor(s, color);
286        a.setName(s);
287        a.setPosition(adjustX(x, doubleWidth), adjustY(y));
288        AnimatedEntity ae = new AnimatedEntity(a, x, y, doubleWidth);
289        animatedEntities.add(ae);
290        return ae;
291    }
292    /**
293     * Create an AnimatedEntity at position x, y, using the String s in the given color. If doubleWidth is true, treats
294     * the String s as starting in the left cell of a pair to be placed in a grid of 2-char cells.
295     * @param x
296     * @param y
297     * @param doubleWidth
298     * @param s
299     * @param colors
300     * @return
301     */
302    public AnimatedEntity animateActor(int x, int y, boolean doubleWidth, String s, Collection<Color> colors)
303    {
304        return animateActor(x, y, doubleWidth, s, colors, 2f);
305    }
306    /**
307     * Create an AnimatedEntity at position x, y, using the String s in the given color. If doubleWidth is true, treats
308     * the String s as starting in the left cell of a pair to be placed in a grid of 2-char cells.
309     * @param x
310     * @param y
311     * @param doubleWidth
312     * @param s
313     * @param colors
314     * @param loopTime
315     * @return
316     */
317    public AnimatedEntity animateActor(int x, int y, boolean doubleWidth, String s, Collection<Color> colors, float loopTime)
318    {
319        Actor a = textFactory.makeActor(s, colors, loopTime, doubleWidth);
320        a.setName(s);
321        a.setPosition(adjustX(x, doubleWidth), adjustY(y));
322        AnimatedEntity ae = new AnimatedEntity(a, x, y, doubleWidth);
323        animatedEntities.add(ae);
324        return ae;
325    }
326    /**
327     * Create an AnimatedEntity at position x, y, using the char c in the given colors to cycle through. If doubleWidth
328     * is true, treats the String s as starting in the left cell of a pair to be placed in a grid of 2-char cells.
329     * @param x
330     * @param y
331     * @param doubleWidth
332     * @param c
333     * @param colors
334     * @return
335     */
336    public AnimatedEntity animateActor(int x, int y, boolean doubleWidth, char c, Collection<Color> colors)
337    {
338        return animateActor(x, y, doubleWidth, c, colors, 2f);
339    }
340    /**
341     * Create an AnimatedEntity at position x, y, using the char c in the given colors to cycle through. If doubleWidth
342     * is true, treats the String s as starting in the left cell of a pair to be placed in a grid of 2-char cells.
343     * @param x
344     * @param y
345     * @param doubleWidth
346     * @param c
347     * @param colors
348     * @param loopTime
349     * @return
350     */
351    public AnimatedEntity animateActor(int x, int y, boolean doubleWidth, char c, Collection<Color> colors, float loopTime)
352    {
353        TextureRegion tr = imageMap.get(c);
354        if(tr != null)
355            return animateActor(x, y, doubleWidth, tr, colors, loopTime, String.valueOf(c));
356        Actor a = textFactory.makeActor(c, colors, loopTime, doubleWidth);
357        a.setName(String.valueOf(c));
358        a.setPosition(adjustX(x, doubleWidth), adjustY(y));
359        AnimatedEntity ae = new AnimatedEntity(a, x, y, doubleWidth);
360        animatedEntities.add(ae);
361        return ae;
362    }
363    /**
364     * Create an AnimatedEntity at position x, y, using '^' as its contents, but as an image so it can be rotated.
365     * Uses the given colors in a looping pattern, that doesn't count as an animation. If doubleWidth is true, treats
366     * the '^' as starting in the middle of a 2-char cell.
367     * @param x
368     * @param y
369     * @param doubleWidth
370     * @param colors
371     * @param loopTime
372     * @return
373     */
374    public AnimatedEntity directionMarker(int x, int y, boolean doubleWidth, Collection<Color> colors, float loopTime)
375    {
376        Actor a = textFactory.makeDirectionMarker(colors, loopTime, doubleWidth);
377        a.setName("^");
378        a.setPosition(adjustX(x, doubleWidth), adjustY(y));
379        AnimatedEntity ae = new AnimatedEntity(a, x, y, doubleWidth);
380        animatedEntities.add(ae);
381        return ae;
382    }
383    public AnimatedEntity directionMarker(int x, int y, boolean doubleWidth, Color color)
384    {
385        Actor a = textFactory.makeDirectionMarker(color);
386        a.setName("^");
387        a.setPosition(adjustX(x, doubleWidth), adjustY(y));
388        AnimatedEntity ae = new AnimatedEntity(a, x, y, doubleWidth);
389        animatedEntities.add(ae);
390        return ae;
391    }
392    /**
393     * Create an AnimatedEntity at position x, y, using the char c with a color looked up by index in palette.
394     * @param x
395     * @param y
396     * @param c
397     * @param index
398     * @param palette
399     * @return
400     */
401    public AnimatedEntity animateActor(int x, int y, char c, int index, ArrayList<Color> palette)
402    {
403        return animateActor(x, y, c, palette.get(index));
404    }

414     */
415    public AnimatedEntity animateActor(int x, int y, String s, int index, ArrayList<Color> palette)

417        return animateActor(x, y, s, palette.get(index));
418    }

420    /**
421     * Create an AnimatedEntity at position x, y, using a TextureRegion with no color modifications, which will be
422     * stretched to fit one cell.

425     * @param texture
426     * @return
427     */

429    {
430        return animateActor(x, y, false, texture, Color.WHITE);

433        a.setName("");
434        a.setPosition(x * cellWidth + getX(), (gridHeight - y - 1) * cellHeight - textFactory.getDescent() + getY());
435
436        AnimatedEntity ae = new AnimatedEntity(a, x, y);
437        animatedEntities.add(ae);
438        return ae;
439        */
440    }

492    /**
493     * Create an AnimatedEntity at position x, y, using a TextureRegion with the given color, which will be
494     * stretched to fit one cell, or two cells if doubleWidth is true.
495     * @param x
496     * @param y
497     * @param doubleWidth
498     * @param texture
499     * @param color
500     * @return
501     */
502    public AnimatedEntity animateActor(int x, int y, boolean doubleWidth, TextureRegion texture, Color color){
503        return animateActor(x, y, doubleWidth, texture, color, "");
504    }
505
506    /**
507     * Create an AnimatedEntity at position x, y, using a TextureRegion with the given color, which will be
508     * stretched to fit one cell, or two cells if doubleWidth is true.
509     * @param x
510     * @param y
511     * @param doubleWidth
512     * @param texture
513     * @param color
514     * @return
515     */
516    public AnimatedEntity animateActor(int x, int y, boolean doubleWidth, TextureRegion texture, Color color, String name){
517        Actor a = textFactory.makeActor(texture, color, (doubleWidth ? 2 : 1) * cellWidth, cellHeight);
518        a.setName(name);
519        a.setPosition(adjustX(x, doubleWidth), adjustY(y));
520        /*
521        if (doubleWidth)
522            a.setPosition(x * 2 * cellWidth + getX(), (gridHeight - y - 1) * cellHeight - textFactory.getDescent() + getY());
523        else
524            a.setPosition(x * cellWidth + getX(), (gridHeight - y - 1) * cellHeight - textFactory.getDescent() + getY());
525        */
526        AnimatedEntity ae = new AnimatedEntity(a, x, y, doubleWidth);
527        animatedEntities.add(ae);
528        return ae;
529    }
530    /**
531     * Create an AnimatedEntity at position x, y, using a TextureRegion with the given color, which will be
532     * stretched to fit one cell, or two cells if doubleWidth is true.
533     * @param x
534     * @param y
535     * @param doubleWidth
536     * @param texture
537     * @param colors
538     * @return
539     */
540    public AnimatedEntity animateActor(int x, int y, boolean doubleWidth, TextureRegion texture, Collection<Color> colors){
541        return animateActor(x, y, doubleWidth, texture, colors, 2f);
542    }
543    /**
544     * Create an AnimatedEntity at position x, y, using a TextureRegion with the given color, which will be
545     * stretched to fit one cell, or two cells if doubleWidth is true.
546     * @param x
547     * @param y
548     * @param doubleWidth
549     * @param texture
550     * @param colors
551     * @return
552     */
553    public AnimatedEntity animateActor(int x, int y, boolean doubleWidth, TextureRegion texture, Collection<Color> colors, float loopTime) {
554        return animateActor(x, y, doubleWidth, texture, colors, loopTime, "");
555    }
556    /**
557     * Create an AnimatedEntity at position x, y, using a TextureRegion with the given color, which will be
558     * stretched to fit one cell, or two cells if doubleWidth is true.
559     * @param x
560     * @param y
561     * @param doubleWidth
562     * @param texture
563     * @param colors
564     * @return
565     */
566    public AnimatedEntity animateActor(int x, int y, boolean doubleWidth, TextureRegion texture, Collection<Color> colors, float loopTime, String name) {
567        Actor a = textFactory.makeActor(texture, colors, loopTime, doubleWidth, (doubleWidth ? 2 : 1) * cellWidth, cellHeight);
568        a.setName(name);
569        a.setPosition(adjustX(x, doubleWidth), adjustY(y));
570        /*
571        if (doubleWidth)
572            a.setPosition(x * 2 * cellWidth + getX(), (gridHeight - y - 1) * cellHeight - textFactory.getDescent() + getY());
573        else
574            a.setPosition(x * cellWidth + getX(), (gridHeight - y - 1) * cellHeight - textFactory.getDescent() + getY());
575        */
576        AnimatedEntity ae = new AnimatedEntity(a, x, y, doubleWidth);
577        animatedEntities.add(ae);
578        return ae;
579    }
580
581    /**
582     * Create an AnimatedEntity at position x, y, using a TextureRegion with no color modifications, which, if and only
583     * if stretch is true, will be stretched to fit one cell, or two cells if doubleWidth is true. If stretch is false,
584     * this will preserve the existing size of texture.
585     * @param x
586     * @param y
587     * @param doubleWidth
588     * @param stretch
589     * @param texture
590     * @return
591     */
592    public AnimatedEntity animateActor(int x, int y, boolean doubleWidth, boolean stretch, TextureRegion texture)
593    {
594        Actor a = (stretch)
595                ? textFactory.makeActor(texture, Color.WHITE, (doubleWidth ? 2 : 1) * cellWidth, cellHeight)
596                : textFactory.makeActor(texture, Color.WHITE, texture.getRegionWidth(), texture.getRegionHeight());
597        a.setName("");
598        a.setPosition(adjustX(x, doubleWidth), adjustY(y));
599        /*
600        if(doubleWidth)
601            a.setPosition(x * 2 * cellWidth + getX(), (gridHeight - y - 1) * cellHeight - textFactory.getDescent() + getY());
602        else
603            a.setPosition(x * cellWidth + getX(), (gridHeight - y - 1) * cellHeight  - textFactory.getDescent() + getY());
604        */
605        AnimatedEntity ae = new AnimatedEntity(a, x, y, doubleWidth);
606        animatedEntities.add(ae);
607        return ae;
608    }
609
610    /**
611     * Create an AnimatedEntity at position x, y, using a TextureRegion with the given color, which, if and only
612     * if stretch is true, will be stretched to fit one cell, or two cells if doubleWidth is true. If stretch is false,
613     * this will preserve the existing size of texture.
614     * @param x
615     * @param y
616     * @param doubleWidth
617     * @param stretch
618     * @param texture
619     * @param color
620     * @return
621     */
622    public AnimatedEntity animateActor(int x, int y, boolean doubleWidth, boolean stretch, TextureRegion texture, Color color) {
623
624        Actor a = (stretch)
625                ? textFactory.makeActor(texture, color, (doubleWidth ? 2 : 1) * cellWidth, cellHeight)
626                : textFactory.makeActor(texture, color, texture.getRegionWidth(), texture.getRegionHeight());
627        a.setName("");
628        a.setPosition(adjustX(x, doubleWidth), adjustY(y));
629        /*
630        if (doubleWidth)
631            a.setPosition(x * 2 * cellWidth + getX(), (gridHeight - y - 1) * cellHeight  - textFactory.getDescent() + getY());
632        else
633            a.setPosition(x * cellWidth + getX(), (gridHeight - y - 1) * cellHeight  - textFactory.getDescent() + getY());
634            */
635        AnimatedEntity ae = new AnimatedEntity(a, x, y, doubleWidth);
636        animatedEntities.add(ae);
637        return ae;
638    }
639    
640        @Override
641        public ISquidPanel<Color> getBacker() {
642                return this;
643        }
644
645        /**
646         * Use this method if you use your own {@link IColorCenter} and want this
647         * panel not to allocate its own colors (or fill
648         * {@link DefaultResources#getSCC()} but instead to the provided center.
649         * 
650         * @param scc
651         *            The color center to use. Should not be {@code null}.
652         * @return {@code this}
653         * @throws NullPointerException
654         *             If {@code scc} is {@code null}.
655         */
656        @Override
657        public ImageSquidPanel setColorCenter(IColorCenter<Color> scc) {
658            super.setColorCenter(scc);
659                return this;
660        }
661
662    /**
663     * Gets a "snapshot" of the data represented by this ImageSquidPanel; stores the dimensions, the char data, and the
664     * color data in a way that can be set back to a SquidPanel or ImageSquidPanel using
665     * {@link #setFromSnapshot(String, int, int, int, int)} or its overload that takes a StringBuilder. The actual
666     * contents of the returned StringBuilder are unlikely to be legible in any way if read as text, and are meant to be
667     * concise and stable across versions.
668     * <br>
669     * NOTE: For this version, the mapping of chars to images is not stored in the snapshot, allowing alternate mappings
670     * to be used, such as while graphics are being updated frequently. This also allows the snapshot to be read in from
671     * both normal SquidPanels and ImageSquidPanels.
672     * @return a StringBuilder representation of this SquidPanel's data that can be passed later to {@link #setFromSnapshot(StringBuilder, int, int, int, int)} or converted to String and passed to its overload
673     */
674    public StringBuilder getSnapshot()
675    {
676        return getSnapshot(0, 0, gridWidth, gridHeight);
677    }
678    /**
679     * Gets a "snapshot" of the data represented by this ImageSquidPanel; stores the dimensions, the char data, and the
680     * color data in a way that can be set back to a SquidPanel or ImageSquidPanel using
681     * {@link #setFromSnapshot(String, int, int, int, int)} or its overload that takes a StringBuilder. The actual
682     * contents of the returned StringBuilder are unlikely to be legible in any way if read as text, and are meant to be
683     * concise and stable across versions. This overload allows the first x and y position used to be specified, as well
684     * as the width and height to use (the actual width and height stored may be different if this SquidPanel's
685     * gridWidth and/or gridHeight are smaller than the width and/or height given).
686     * <br>
687     * NOTE: For this version, the mapping of chars to images is not stored in the snapshot, allowing alternate mappings
688     * to be used, such as while graphics are being updated frequently. This also allows the snapshot to be read in from
689     * both normal SquidPanels and ImageSquidPanels.
690     * @param startX the first x position to use in the snapshot, inclusive
691     * @param startY the first y position to use in the snapshot, inclusive
692     * @param width how wide the snapshot area should be; x positions from startX to startX + width - 1 will be used
693     * @param height how tall the snapshot area should be; y positions from startY to startY + height - 1 will be used
694     * @return a StringBuilder representation of this SquidPanel's data that can be passed later to {@link #setFromSnapshot(StringBuilder, int, int, int, int)} or converted to String and passed to its overload
695     */
696    public StringBuilder getSnapshot(int startX, int startY, int width, int height) {
697        width = Math.min(gridWidth - startX, width);
698        height = Math.min(gridHeight - startY, height);
699        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(width * height * 9 + 12);
700        sb.append(width).append('x').append(height).append(':');
701        for (int x = startX, i = 0; i < width; x++, i++) {
702            sb.append(contents[x], startY, height);
703        }
704        char[] reuse = new char[8];
705        for (int x = startX, i = 0; i < width; x++, i++) {
706            for (int y = startY, j = 0; j < height; y++, j++) {
707                sb.append(SColor.floatToChars(reuse, colors[x][y]));
708            }
709        }
710        return sb;
711    }
712
713    /**
714     * Given a "snapshot" from {@link #getSnapshot(int, int, int, int)}, this assigns the chars and colors in this
715     * ImageSquidPanel from 0,0 (inclusive) up to the dimensions stored in the snapshot to match the snapshot's data.
716     * @param snapshot a StringBuilder in a special format as produced by {@link #getSnapshot(int, int, int, int)}
717     * @return this after setting, for chaining
718     */
719    public ImageSquidPanel setFromSnapshot(StringBuilder snapshot)
720    {
721        return setFromSnapshot(snapshot, 0, 0, -1, -1);
722    }
723    /**
724     * Given a "snapshot" from {@link #getSnapshot(int, int, int, int)}, this assigns the chars and colors in this
725     * ImageSquidPanel from the position given by putX,putY (inclusive) up to the dimensions stored in the snapshot
726     * (considering putX and putY as offsets) so they have the values stored in the snapshot.
727     * @param snapshot a StringBuilder in a special format as produced by {@link #getSnapshot(int, int, int, int)}
728     * @param putX where to start placing the data from the snapshot, x position
729     * @param putY where to start placing the data from the snapshot, y position
730     * @return this after setting, for chaining
731     */
732    public ImageSquidPanel setFromSnapshot(StringBuilder snapshot, int putX, int putY)
733    {
734        return setFromSnapshot(snapshot, putX, putY, -1, -1);
735    }
736    /**
737     * Given a "snapshot" from {@link #getSnapshot(int, int, int, int)}, this assigns the chars and colors in this
738     * ImageSquidPanel from the position given by putX,putY (inclusive) to putX+limitWidth,putY+limitHeight (exclusive)
739     * so they have the values stored in the snapshot. If limitWidth or limitHeight is negative, this uses the full
740     * width and height of the snapshot (stopping early if it would extend past the gridWidth or gridHeight of this
741     * ImageSquidPanel).
742     * @param snapshot a StringBuilder in a special format as produced by {@link #getSnapshot(int, int, int, int)}
743     * @param putX where to start placing the data from the snapshot, x position
744     * @param putY where to start placing the data from the snapshot, y position
745     * @param limitWidth if negative, uses all of snapshot's width as possible, otherwise restricts the width allowed
746     * @param limitHeight if negative, uses all of snapshot's height as possible, otherwise restricts the height allowed
747     * @return this after setting, for chaining
748     */
749    public ImageSquidPanel setFromSnapshot(StringBuilder snapshot, int putX, int putY, int limitWidth, int limitHeight)
750    {
751        if(putX >= gridWidth || putY >= gridHeight || snapshot == null || snapshot.length() < 4) return this;
752        if(putX < 0) putX = 0;
753        if(putY < 0) putY = 0;
754        int start = snapshot.indexOf(":")+1, width = StringKit.intFromDec(snapshot),
755                height = StringKit.intFromDec(snapshot, snapshot.indexOf("x") + 1, start),
756                run = start;
757        if(limitWidth < 0)
758            limitWidth = Math.min(width, gridWidth - putX);
759        else
760            limitWidth = Math.min(limitWidth, Math.min(width, gridWidth - putX));
761
762        if(limitHeight < 0)
763            limitHeight = Math.min(height, gridHeight - putY);
764        else
765            limitHeight = Math.min(limitHeight, Math.min(height, gridHeight - putY));
766        for (int x = putX, i = 0; i < limitWidth; x++, i++, run += height) {
767            snapshot.getChars(run, run + limitHeight, contents[x], putY);
768        }
769        run = start + width * height;
770        for (int x = putX, i = 0; i < limitWidth; x++, i++) {
771            for (int y = putY, j = 0; j < limitHeight; y++, j++) {
772                colors[x][y] = SColor.charsToFloat(snapshot, run);
773                run += 8;
774            }
775        }
776        return this;
777    }
778
779    /**
780     * Given a "snapshot" from {@link #getSnapshot(int, int, int, int)}, this assigns the chars and colors in this
781     * ImageSquidPanel from 0,0 (inclusive) up to the dimensions stored in the snapshot to match the snapshot's data.
782     * <br>
783     * This overload takes a String instead of a StringBuilder for potentially-easier loading from files.
784     * @param snapshot a String in a special format as produced by {@link #getSnapshot(int, int, int, int)}
785     * @return this after setting, for chaining
786     */
787    public ImageSquidPanel setFromSnapshot(String snapshot)
788    {
789        return setFromSnapshot(snapshot, 0, 0, -1, -1);
790    }
791    /**
792     * Given a "snapshot" from {@link #getSnapshot(int, int, int, int)}, this assigns the chars and colors in this
793     * ImageSquidPanel from the position given by putX,putY (inclusive) up to the dimensions stored in the snapshot
794     * (considering putX and putY as offsets) so they have the values stored in the snapshot.
795     * <br>
796     * This overload takes a String instead of a StringBuilder for potentially-easier loading from files.
797     * @param snapshot a String in a special format as produced by {@link #getSnapshot(int, int, int, int)}
798     * @param putX where to start placing the data from the snapshot, x position
799     * @param putY where to start placing the data from the snapshot, y position
800     * @return this after setting, for chaining
801     */
802    public ImageSquidPanel setFromSnapshot(String snapshot, int putX, int putY)
803    {
804        return setFromSnapshot(snapshot, putX, putY, -1, -1);
805    }
806
807    /**
808     * Given a "snapshot" from {@link #getSnapshot(int, int, int, int)}, this assigns the chars and colors in this
809     * ImageSquidPanel from the position given by putX,putY (inclusive) to putX+limitWidth,putY+limitHeight (exclusive)
810     * so they have the values stored in the snapshot. If limitWidth or limitHeight is negative, this uses the full
811     * width and height of the snapshot (stopping early if it would extend past the gridWidth or gridHeight of this
812     * ImageSquidPanel).
813     * <br>
814     * This overload takes a String instead of a StringBuilder for potentially-easier loading from files.
815     * @param snapshot a String in a special format as produced by {@link #getSnapshot(int, int, int, int)}
816     * @param putX where to start placing the data from the snapshot, x position
817     * @param putY where to start placing the data from the snapshot, y position
818     * @param limitWidth if negative, uses all of snapshot's width as possible, otherwise restricts the width allowed
819     * @param limitHeight if negative, uses all of snapshot's height as possible, otherwise restricts the height allowed
820     * @return this after setting, for chaining
821     */
822
823    public ImageSquidPanel setFromSnapshot(String snapshot, int putX, int putY, int limitWidth, int limitHeight)
824    {
825        if(putX >= gridWidth || putY >= gridHeight || snapshot == null || snapshot.length() < 4) return this;
826        if(putX < 0) putX = 0;
827        if(putY < 0) putY = 0;
828        int start = snapshot.indexOf(":")+1, width = StringKit.intFromDec(snapshot),
829                height = StringKit.intFromDec(snapshot, snapshot.indexOf("x") + 1, start),
830                run = start;
831        if(limitWidth < 0)
832            limitWidth = Math.min(width, gridWidth - putX);
833        else
834            limitWidth = Math.min(limitWidth, Math.min(width, gridWidth - putX));
835
836        if(limitHeight < 0)
837            limitHeight = Math.min(height, gridHeight - putY);
838        else
839            limitHeight = Math.min(limitHeight, Math.min(height, gridHeight - putY));
840        for (int x = putX, i = 0; i < limitWidth; x++, i++, run += height) {
841            snapshot.getChars(run, run + limitHeight, contents[x], putY);
842        }
843        run = start + width * height;
844        for (int x = putX, i = 0; i < limitWidth; x++, i++) {
845            for (int y = putY, j = 0; j < limitHeight; y++, j++) {
846                colors[x][y] = SColor.charsToFloat(snapshot, run);
847                run += 8;
848            }
849        }
850        return this;
851    }
852
853    /**
854     * Makes it so when the char swapOut would be drawn, the TextureRegion swapIn is drawn instead.
855     * This will apply for as long as this ImageSquidPanel is in use unless swapIn is removed with
856     * {@link #removeImageSwap(char)} or directly changing this object's {@link #imageMap}.
857     * @param swapOut the char to avoid rendering and replace with an image
858     * @param swapIn the image to replace the character with
859     */
860    public void setImageSwap(final char swapOut, final TextureRegion swapIn)
861    {
862        if(swapIn != null)
863            imageMap.put(swapOut, swapIn);
864    }
865
866    /**
867     * Removes the char toRemove from the mapping of chars to replace with images, or does nothing if this did not
868     * already replace toRemove with an image. This means toRemove will render as itself, if present in the font.
869     * @param toRemove the char to render as a glyph instead of a texture
870     */
871    public void removeImageSwap(final char toRemove)
872    {
873        imageMap.remove(toRemove);
874    }
875
876    /**
877     * If there is a TextureRegion that would replace the char toFind when drawn, this will return that TextureRegion,
878     * otherwise it returns null.
879     * @param toFind the char to find the corresponding TextureRegion that it could be mapped to
880     * @return the corresponding TextureRegion if it exists, or null otherwise
881     */
882    public TextureRegion getImageSwap(final char toFind)
883    {
884        return imageMap.get(toFind);
885    }
886
887    /**
888     * Meant for taking easy-to-write chars and generating chars that can map to images, while still allowing the
889     * original easy-to-write char to be used as its own non-image char. Given a char that should be from the
890     * "relatively common" parts of Unicode (essentially, anything with a codepoint before 0x1000, or with a small risk
891     * of collision, anything before 0x8000), this returns a character from the "Private Use Area" of Unicode that will
892     * probably be unique for most kinds of input. 4096 possible chars can be returned by this method.
893     *
894     * As an example, you may want to map the char 'g' to an image of a goblin, but still sometimes show the actual 'g'
895     * for some other monster or a variant on goblins you don't have an image for. You could call
896     * {@code char goblinChar = ImageSquidPanel.getUnusedChar('g');} and then register goblinChar in the image mapping
897     * with {@code myImageSquidPanel.setImageSwap(goblinChar, goblinImage);}, which would allow you to draw 'g' directly
898     * by placing a 'g' with put(), or draw goblinImage by placing either goblinChar or
899     * {@code ImageSquidPanel.getUnusedChar('g')} with put().
900     *
901     * @param initial a char that ideally should be from the earlier parts of Unicode (before 0x1000 is ideal)
902     * @return a char from Unicode's private use area that is unlikely to be found otherwise or accidentally
903     */
904    public static char getUnusedChar(final char initial)
905    {
906        return (char)(((initial & 0x7000) >>> 3 ^ initial) & 0x0FFF | 0xE000);
907    }
908}
